intro: Microstachys serrulata, commonly known as the serrated microstachys, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, serrated leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively obscure in horticultural circles.
